Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a fish living in water and label it.
The student can draw and label the water as a part of the fish's habitat.
The student can draw and label other elements in the habitat, like plants or rocks, that the fish might need.
The student can show and label the relationship between the fish and its need for water to survive.
The student can draw and label how the habitat provides the fish with what it needs, such as clean water and food plants.
The student can demonstrate how the fish and its habitat are part of a system that works together to meet its needs.
